items.label: Host
items.description:
The Modbus TCP server hostname or IP address.

Examples:
- localhost
- 192.168.1.100
- plc.factory.local

items.label: Port
items.description:
The Modbus TCP server port.

Default Modbus TCP port is 502.

Some devices use alternative ports like 5020 or custom ports.

items.label: Slave ID
items.description:
The Modbus slave/unit identifier (1-247).

Also known as Unit ID or Station Address.

Most devices use ID 1, but some gateways or multi-drop networks require specific IDs.

items.label: Polling Interval (ms)
items.description:
How often to read all configured registers (in milliseconds).

Lower values = more frequent updates but higher network/CPU load.

Typical values:
- 100ms: High-frequency monitoring
- 1000ms: Standard monitoring
- 5000ms: Low-frequency monitoring

Note: Very fast polling may overload slow PLCs.

items.label: Connection Timeout (ms)
items.description:
Maximum time to wait for initial TCP connection (in milliseconds).

Increase for slow networks or remote connections.

items.label: Read Timeout (ms)
items.description:
Maximum time to wait for a Modbus response (in milliseconds).

Increase if the PLC is slow to respond or network has high latency.

items.label: Retries
items.description:
Number of retry attempts on communication failure.

Set to 0 to disable retries.

Recommended: 2-3 retries for reliable operation.

items.label: Retry Delay (ms)
items.description:
Delay between retry attempts (in milliseconds).

Allows the device time to recover before retrying.

items.label: Register Definitions
items.description:
Define the Modbus registers to read (one per line).

Format: name:type:address[:length]

Register Types:
- coil: Read/write bits (function code 1)
- discrete: Read-only bits (function code 2)
- holding: Read/write 16-bit registers (function code 3)
- input: Read-only 16-bit registers (function code 4)

Examples:
temperature:holding:0:1
pressure:holding:1:1
status_bits:coil:0:16
sensor_value:input:100:2

Lines starting with # are comments.
